business.headline: Who is Vasundhra Oswal, daughter of Indian billionaire, detained in Uganda?Vasundhara Oswal was reportedly seized by a group of 20 armed men at the family's extra neutral alcohol (ENA) plant. Local officials have connected her arrest to an ongoing investigation into the case of a missing person.

HDFC Bank Q2 results: Net profit rises 5% to Rs 16,820 croreHDFC Bank's net interest income (NII), a key measure of profitability, came in at Rs 30,114 crore, reflecting a 10% year-on-year increase, although slightly below the market expectation of Rs 30,306 crore.

Karnataka to impose cess on Zomato, Uber, payments to support gig workersKarnataka Labour Minister Santosh Lad said that the charge would be levied only on transport and not on the purchase of products.

Disney-Reliance venture to stream live sports exclusively on Hotstar: ReportWhile Reliance's JioCinema currently streams IPL cricket, Hotstar holds rights to other prestigious events like the International Cricket Council (ICC) tournaments, the English Premier League, and the Pro Kabaddi League.

Ashneer Grover withdraws mismanagement plea against BharatPe from NCLTThe plea alleged mismanagement and oppressive conduct by the fintech company's board. The withdrawal of the plea follows a settlement reached between Grover and BharatPe on September 30, 2024.

India to impose laptop import restrictions to boost local manufacturing: ReportThe planned restrictions, if enforced, could impact the country's IT hardware market, which is currently valued at between $8 billion and $10 billion.
Sensex, Nifty close in green as banking, metal stocks lift marketThe S&P BSE Sensex added 218.14 points to close at, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 104.20 points to end at 24,854.05.

DA hike by 3%: Check new salary, arrear calculations for employees, pensionersThe DA hike increase is effective from July 1, 2024, and was confirmed during a Cabinet meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday.

India's growth rate shines bright in global economy, says Ajay Banga A lot of that growth is in India, is driven by the domestic market as well, which actually is a healthy sign, in some ways, said Ajay Banga, World Bank president.

IGL, MGL shares plunge up to 15% today. Here's why MGL's stock plummeted 11%, reaching a low of Rs 1,568.30, while IGL experienced a 10% drop, closing at Rs 453.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange as of latest update.

Vistara to operate with 'AI 2' code after merger with Air IndiaVistara, a joint venture between the Tata Group and Singapore Airlines Limited (SIA), is set to formally merge with Air India on November 12, 2024.

Hyundai IPO: GMP signals discounted listing, but can it pull off a surprise?Hyundai IPO listing: Despite the buzz around the automaker's stock market debut, analysts and investors are divided on whether the stock will exceed expectations or struggle, given current market signals.
Explained: Why Infosys shares fell 5% after Q2 results Infosys share price: Infosys reported a profit after tax (PAT) of Rs 6,506 crore for the second quarter (Q2) ending in September 2024.

Wipro shares gain 4% post Q2 results, bonus issue news. Time to buy? The rally came after Wipro announced its second-quarter (Q2) results for the fiscal year 2025 (FY25), posting a 21.3% year-on-year (YoY) jump in net profit to Rs 3,209 crore.
Amazon AWS CEO warns staff: Return to office or resignAmazon AWS CEO Matt Garman defended the decision to implement a five-day in-office work week starting in January 2024.

Explained: Why European Central Bank cut interest rates againECB cuts interest rates: This marks the first time the ECB has implemented back-to-back rate cuts since it began its current cycle of easing in response to falling inflation rates.

RBI action against Navi Finserv, 3 other NBFCs: What it means for customersRBI's regulatory action comes in response to concerns over their loan pricing policies and other regulatory violations, sparking questions about the implications for customers.

Did not run away, will return to India: Byju Raveendran amid insolvency crisisSpeaking during his first virtual press conference in four years, Raveendran refuted rumours that he had fled India to avoid the ongoing insolvency crisis.
Explained: Why Manappuram Finance shares crashed 16% todayAt around 10:30 am shares of Manappuram Finance were down 16.15% to Rs 148.75 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Champai Soren, Babulal Marandi, Sita Soren in BJP's first list for JharkhandAs per the list, Babulal Marandi will be contesting polls from Dhanwar seat, while Champai Soren is set to represent Saraikela.

BJP fields Navya Haridas for Wayanad bypoll against Congress's Priyanka GandhiElections in Wayanad were necessitated after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who had won seats in both Wayanad and Raebareli, decided to retain the latter.

Aviation safety panel meets CEOs of airlines amid hoax bomb threats: SourcesZulfiquar Hasan, the Director General of BCAS, met the CEOs of domestic airlines and assured them that all security protocols were being followed, sources said.

Netanyahu's strong message after drone attack on residence: Won't deter meThe rare video statement by Benjamin Netanyahu, released on Shabbat, the Jewish day of rest, came in the wake of a drone attack that targeted his residence in Caesarea.

Can India defend 107 in Bengaluru Test? Here's what history says IND vs NZ: Rohit Sharma's India need to defend 107 runs against Tom Latham's New Zealand to win the Bengaluru Test and take a 1-0 lead in the three-match series.

Vikash Yadav, wanted by US over Pannun murder plot, was arrested for extortionThe arrest came weeks after Vikash Yadav was mentioned by the US Department of Justice as a co-conspirator in the alleged Gurpatwant Pannun murder plot.

Who is Vasundhra Oswal, daughter of Indian billionaire, detained in Uganda?Vasundhara Oswal was reportedly seized by a group of 20 armed men at the family's extra neutral alcohol (ENA) plant. Local officials have connected her arrest to an ongoing investigation into the case of a missing person.

Two Border Police jawans killed, 2 other injured in Naxal attack in ChhattisgarhTwo Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) jawans were injured in an IED blast while returning from an anti-Naxal operation in Chhattisgarh on Saturday.

Diljit Dosanjh crafts history as 1st Indian artiste to feature on Billboard CanadaDiljit Dosanjh has achieved a historic milestone by becoming the first Indian artiste to be featured on the cover of Billboard Canada. This special edition will include exclusive content from his Dil-Luminati tour.

IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme: Shaping the Future of Tech LeadershipAdvance your career with IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme. Designed for aspiring tech leaders, this programme offers cutting-edge insights, practical experience, and strategic acumen to navigate the digital era. Gain the skills to drive innovation, lead digital transformations, and position yourself as a visionary in technology leadership.

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.

Hemant Soren's party, Congress to contest 70 of 81 seats in Jharkhand pollsHemant Soren on Saturday said that the INDIA bloc partners, consisting of Congress, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD), Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM), and the Left parties, will contest the upcoming assembly polls together and the Congress and the JMM will field candidates in 70 of 81 seats.
Why do you doze off on the couch but are wide awake in bed?Ever find yourself dozing off on the couch, only to be wide awake the moment you hit the bed? Let's find out from experts why this happens.

Thank God Pant survived run-out: Sarfaraz on his viral jumping momentSarfaraz Khan's animated reaction to save Rishabh Pant from a run-out during Day 4 of India's first Test against New Zealand went viral. Sarfaraz later revealed his concern about Pant's knee injury, adding depth to the heartwarming moment.

Union Minister detained for staging protest with government job aspirantsThe candidates protested at Ashok Nagar, the hub of coaching institutions for civil services and other competitive exams in Hyderabad.

Rohit argues with umpire before heavy rain in dramatic Bengaluru scenesIndia captain Rohit Sharma was seen arguing with umpire Michael Gough on Day 4 of the first Test against New Zealand, urging him not to halt play due to bad light. The match was later interrupted by heavy rain, adding drama to India's defense.

At 67, Sunny Deol still packs 'Dhai Kilo Ka' punch without reinventing himselfSunny Deol, at 67, remains a beloved Bollywood icon, delivering powerful performances without conforming to trends. His authenticity and emotional depth continue to resonate with audiences.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

They're clearly on notice: Canada on remaining Indian diplomatsCanada's Minister of Foreign Affairs, Melanie Joly, said that the Justin Trudeau government "will not tolerate any diplomats who endanger the safety of Canadians".

Baba Siddique had links with Dawood, claims arrested Bishnoi gang shooterSpeaking to the media in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura, a member of Lawrence Bishnoi's gang said that Baba Siddique was killed because he was not a good man and was associated with gangster Dawood Ibrahim.

Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar, the Nobel laureate who united astronomy and physicsNobel laureate Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar was one of the first scientists ever to merge the fields of physics and astronomy. Best known for the Chandrasekhar Limit, his work helped explain the life cycles of stars and the formation of black holes and neutron stars.

Over 100, including 42 women, arrested for 'obscene dance' at Hyderabad pubBased on a tip-off, a Hyderabad Police team raided a pub in the city's posh Banjara Hills area and arrested 140 people, including 42 women, for allegedly being involved in obscene dance performances.

Karnataka to impose cess on Zomato, Uber, payments to support gig workersKarnataka Labour Minister Santosh Lad said that the charge would be levied only on transport and not on the purchase of products.
Lt Governor approves J&K Cabinet's resolution on full statehoodThe Cabinet's resolution called for the restoration of Jammu and Kashmir's statehood "in its original form."

Actor Naga Chaitanya shares lift selfie with fiancee Sobhita Dhulipala. See picActor Naga Chaitanya shared a lift selfie with fiancee, Sobhita Dhulipala. The two were seen casually dressed in the picture.

Vijay Varma recalls how Sunidhi Chauhan was scared of him after Pink screeningActor Vijay Varma discusses how his roles as a villain in films and series have led to people being frightened of him in real life. He shares experiences from screenings and the effects of his on-screen persona on his personal interactions.

Director Vinod Kapri's Pyre to premiere at Europe's Tallinn Black Nights FestivalVinod Kapri's film Pyre, set in Uttarakhand's remote mountains, will have its world premiere at the Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival. This marks the only Indian film in the competition and features an international crew including composer Mychael Danna and editor Patricia Rommel.

Anushka Ranjan on #MeToo: Have experienced it, will speak when I'm readyAnushka Ranjan, in an exclusive interview, spoke about the #MeToo movement in the South film industry, highlighting the challenges faced despite her privileged background. She emphasised the importance of self-worth and empowerment while stating that she will speak in detail when ready.

sports.headline: Watch: Abhishek, Sufiyan in heated exchange in India A vs Pakistan A clash Men's Emerging Asia Cup 2024: Abhishek Sharma, Sufiyan Muqeem got involved in a heated exchange after the Pakistani spinner gave Abhishek a send off.

I keep talking to my father for motivation: Sarfaraz Khan IND vs NZ, 1st Test: Sarfaraz Khan scored his maiden Test hundred in Bengaluru and helped India recover in the second innings. Sarafraz scored 150 off 195 balls before Tim Southee accounted for his wicket.

Not going to be easy win: William O'Rourke wary of 'world class' IndiaIND vs NZ: William O'Rourke said that New Zealand would not have it easy chasing the target of 105 on Day 5 of the opening Test against India at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

Let's repeat Duleep Trophy: Sarfaraz reveals chat with Pant during Day 4Sarfaraz Khan revealed a vital conversation with Rishabh Pant that ignited their aggressive partnership on Day 4 of the Bengaluru Test. Recalling their Duleep Trophy experience, the duo's attacking approach led to India's commanding 462-run total against New Zealand.

New Zealand won't have it easy: Sarfaraz backs India to defend 107-run target Sarfaraz Khan suggested that New Zealand might find it challenging to chase the modest target of 107 runs on the final day at Chinnaswamy Stadium, especially if India can claim early wickets as the pitch begins to deteriorate.

German tennis star Eva Lys calls out troll for 'insulting' herGerman tennis star Eva Lys called out online trolls after facing abuse following her defeat in the Japan Women's Open 2024 quarterfinal on Friday. Eva lost to Japan's Aoi Ito in three sets in the quarters.

Gaikwad leads Maharashtra response after Shreyas hundred lifts MumbaiMaharashtra skipper Ruturaj Gaikwad's unbeaten 80 led to a determined response against Mumbai on the second day of their Ranji Trophy Group A clash. However, Maharashtra still trail by 173 runs.

'KL Rahul should be dropped': Fans upset after Bengaluru Test flop showA certain section of fans was upset on social media about KL Rahul's performance in the Bengaluru Test vs New Zealand. They asked Rahul to be dropped from the next Test.

Watch: Neeraj Chopra pranks his parting coach while doing viral Instagram trendNeeraj Chopra pranked his parting coach Bartonietz in a viral Instagram post. Neeraj Chopra and his coach Klaus Bartonietz are ending their five-year partnership. Bartonietz, citing age and family commitments, has decided to part ways with Chopra.

KL Rahul drops to his knees after Rishabh Pant falls for 99 in BengaluruRishabh Pant overtook MS Dhoni in the list of Indian wicketkeepers with the most Test hundreds. The batter slammed a sensational hundred in the Bengaluru Test match to lead India's mega comeback in the 1st game of the series.

Pant can't be measured by numbers: Fans and pundits react to unlucky 99Rishabh Pant fell heartbreakingly short of a century, dismissed for 99 on Day 4 of India's first Test against New Zealand in Bengaluru. Despite the disappointment, fans and pundits praised his fearless batting and praised his resilience despite an earlier injury.

Unlucky 99: Pant joins MS Dhoni, Sourav Ganguly in unwanted Test listIND vs NZ: Rishabh Pant scored 99 runs off 105 balls before William O'Rourke dismissed him. He also became the 10th Indian batter to get out on 99 in Test cricket.

Rishabh Pant slog sweeps Tim Southee for 107m six: Rahul, Glenn Phillips in shockRishabh Pant's slog-sweep six landed outside the M Chinnaswamy Stadium. He hit a 107m six against Tim Southee and left KL Rahul and Glenn Phillips stunned. However, Pant got dismissed at 99, missing out on a well-deserved hundred.

Sarfaraz Khan receives standing ovation from Bengaluru crowd after superb 150India vs New Zealand: Sarfaraz Khan earned a well-deserved standing ovation from both the crowd and the Indian dressing room after Tim Southee brought an end to his marathon 150-run innings in the second session.

Moulded in Mumbai maidans, Sarfaraz Khan leads India's heroic recovery in BengaluruSarfaraz Khan's remarkable maiden Test century against New Zealand in Bengaluru highlights his talent and determination. Overcoming challenges and fitness concerns, his journey reflects resilience and support from cricketing icons like Sunil Gavaskar.

Overcoming challenges and fitness concerns, his journey reflects resilience and support from cricketing icons like Sunil Gavaskar.

Watch: Virat Kohli comes out to check rain, Bengaluru crowd eruptsIndia vs New Zealand: Virat Kohli received massive cheers at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. The batter walked out of the dressing room to check the state of the rain and was welcomed by huge roars.

Street smart Sarfaraz Khan knows how to put pressure back on bowlers: KumbleFormer India captain and coach Anil Kumble hailed Sarfaraz Khan for his stunning century in Bengaluru. Kumble said that Sarfaraz was street-smart and knew how to put pressure back on the bowlers.

Trent Alexander-Arnold not distracted by Real Madrid links: Liverpool boss SlotLiverpool coach Arne Slot assures fans that Trent Alexander-Arnold remains committed to his role at Anfield, despite ongoing transfer rumours linking him to Real Madrid. As the Reds lead the Premier League table, Slot expresses confidence in his players' mental resilience.

RCB aajao yaar: Rohit Sharma responds to fan's request during Bengaluru TestA video went viral on social media as Rohit Sharma responded to a fan's special request at M Chinnaswamy Stadium. In a light-hearted manner, the fan requested Rohit to join the Royal Challengers Bengaluru franchise.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
